question.title: Insomnia: [oauth2] Failed to get token ReferenceError: window is not defined
question.body:
I am trying to integrate Insomnia Collection in CI. I have the tests written on Insomnia as a collection which runs absolutely fine via the GUI, also giving the test results defined in post-request script.

I have OAuth 2.0 Authorisation, which prompts a window where I enter my user name and password when i send the request the first time.

While running the same collection via the CLI using command

inso run collection

I get the following error

[oauth2] Failed to get token ReferenceError: window is not defined
    at Qwi (C:\snapshot\insomnia-ee\packages\insomnia-inso\dist\index.js)
    at process.processTicksAndRejections (node:internal/process/task_queues:105:5)
    at async Zft (C:\snapshot\insomnia-ee\packages\insomnia-inso\dist\index.js)
    at async Dxe (C:\snapshot\insomnia-ee\packages\insomnia-inso\dist\index.js)
    at async C:\snapshot\insomnia-ee\packages\insomnia-inso\dist\index.js
    at async e.<anonymous> (C:\snapshot\insomnia-ee\packages\insomnia-inso\dist\index.js)
    at async e.parseAsync (C:\snapshot\insomnia-ee\packages\insomnia-inso\dist\index.js)
*

And the tests consequently show as failed.

How do I get through the authorisation process while running via CLI?
